snippet: Consumers already knew that not everything is good for you, and this was never truer than with a Twinkie, a Sno Ball or a Ring Ding — the Ding Dong equivalent in the Northeast.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column memorializes the delights of heavily-processed desserts made by Hostess Brands, which has declared bankruptcy; contends that the rise of health-conscious consumers, rather than labor difficulties, is the true force behind Hostess' demise.
lead_paragraph: Consumers already knew that not everything is good for you, and this was never truer than with a Twinkie, a Sno Ball or a Ring Ding — the Ding Dong equivalent in the Northeast.

headline.print_headline: Back When a Chocolate Puck Tasted, Guiltily, Like America
headline.seo: Back When a Ring Ding Tasted, Guiltily, Like America
headline.main: Back When a Chocolate Puck Tasted, Guiltily, Like America
